meanings.definition: The practice of invoking spirits or demons for magical purposes.
meanings.sent1: She delved into the world of goety to learn about summoning spirits.
meanings.sent2: The goety of ancient civilizations often involved complex rituals.
meanings.sent3: The magician's goety went wrong when he accidentally summoned a mischievous spirit.
meanings.sent4: Her goety was like a dance with the unknown, each step a careful incantation.
meanings.sent5: The book detailed the secrets of goety, revealing the power of spirit invocation.

meanings.sent1: The goety was known for their ability to communicate with otherworldly beings.
meanings.sent2: In the dark alley, a mysterious figure emerged, a known goety in the town.
meanings.sent3: The goety's cat seemed to have a special connection to the spirit world.
meanings.sent4: He was a modern-day goety, using ancient rituals to connect with spirits.
meanings.sent5: The old man was rumored to be a powerful goety, with tales of his magical feats spreading far and wide.

meanings.definition: The act of performing goetic rituals.
meanings.sent1: The goety of the ceremony was mesmerizing, drawing in all who watched.
meanings.sent2: The goety of the ritual was carefully planned and executed under the moonlight.
meanings.sent3: The goety of the performance left the audience in awe of the magician's skills.
meanings.sent4: The goety of the night seemed to enhance the power of the ancient incantations.
meanings.sent5: The goety of the moment filled the room with an otherworldly energy, tingling with magic.
